Class CookiePizza

extends Pizza

    • Constructor Detail

      • CookiePizza

        public CookiePizza(java.lang.String orderLine)
        The constructor will need to do two things. Firstly, it will have to call super() to make an ArrayList of toppings. Secondly, it will need to assign a new parameter, String cookieCrust. Also note that the Pizza constructor usually expects a string of "Pizza,topping,topping,etc". Our new orderLine string follows a different format.
        Parameters:
        orderLine - a String in the format of "Cookie pizza,cookieCrust,topping,topping,etc"

    • Method Detail

      • calculatePrice

        public double calculatePrice()
        calculatePrice will be $2.49 less than a normal pizza. It will be useful to call Pizza's calculatePrice method.
        Specified by:
        calculatePrice in interface MenuItem
        Overrides:
        calculatePrice in class Pizza
        Returns:
        the price of a cookiePizza

      • getReceipt

        public java.lang.String getReceipt()
        getReceipt will look exactly the same as pizza.getReceipt() but with the additional line to write what cookieCrust the customer ordered. For a cookie pizza with strawberries as a topping and a chocolate chip crust, the method will create the following: PIZZA 8.99 STRAWBERRIES CHOCOLATE CHIP Super will also be useful here to prevent us from repeating our code.
        Specified by:
        getReceipt in interface MenuItem
        Overrides:
        getReceipt in class Pizza
        Returns:
        a String to be used on the receipt
